result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Londell N Gray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution worksheet.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Londell Gray in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based on defendant's completion of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participation Contract and on motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on Motion of the State,  Court ordered the following Restitution amounts converted FORTHWITH to a civil judgment,  subject to Tax intercept.

1.)  EDWARD W. for THREE HUNDRED ELEVEN DOLLARS ($311.00).
2.)  JAMES F. for FOUR HUNDRED FIFTY-EIGHT DOLLARS ($458.00).
3.)  JENNIFER C. for ONE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED TWENTY DOLLARS ($1,520.00).

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant TWO (2) points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for August 25, 2017 at 09:30 am.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TURNED OVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT.  UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO REVERT TO $250.00 PR BOND.

Defendant Londell N Gray in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Londell N Gray in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant was NOT produced.  Matter is ADJOURNED to 08-24-2016 at 02:30 pm for further Proceedings.  sdg
Defendant has been accpeted into DTC/DPA.  Matter is adjourned to Br. 33 for further Proceedings.  sdg
Received call from Attorney Jeremy Arn requesting to adjourn today's Status conference to September 15, 2016 at 8:30.   clw

The Court's calendar had this case down for July 12, 2016.  Counsels had this case down for July 13, 2016.  Parties requested an adjournment as Defendant gets sentenced in Ozaukee County on July 21, 2016 and parties wanted to wait until that sentencing was done before they proceeded with this case.  Matter set for a status conference on August 15, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 18, Judge Colon's court.

ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2016, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE PEDRO COLON, BRANCH #18, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Matter is adjourned for a status conference to July 12, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.  LAST ADJOURNMENT

Defendant Londell N Gray in court with attorney Ann Jaspers for Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Londell N Gray in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored.

Defendant Londell N Gray in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Londell N Gray in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO ALL MISDEMEANOR CHARGES.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
